meanings.definition: In a way that is suitable or appropriate in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She dressed presentably for the job interview.
meanings.sent2: He always behaves presentably in public.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to act presentably by sitting still during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were arranged presentably in the vase, adding a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The student presented her project presentably, impressing the entire class.

meanings.definition: In a way that is acceptable or satisfactory in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The cake was decorated presentably for the party.
meanings.sent2: The children behaved presentably during the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to look presentably by grooming itself before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The old house was renovated presentably, preserving its historical charm.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together presentably to complete the project on time.
